page.title: 03GROSMONT 3 BUILDINGS
page.content: In the centre of the village is the {Town Hall}which was presented to the village in 1902 by the{Duke of {Beaufort.}The ground floor is an open area.A market used to be held in and around the{Town Hall}and it still has a market stone.There used to be several{Public Houses.The Angel, Duke {of York}and{The Greyhound}but only{The {Angel}remains. Grosmont has houses of all ages. Many houses have been altered and added to over the years, Some were formerly shops,butcheries bakeries or general stores.Recently, if in demand, they might go back into buisness like the{Old Bakery.}We have a small school in Grosmont.It was built in 1877.Lessons were originally taught in the{Old Town Hall.}Following the wishes of the {Burgesses }the school was then held in the {New Town {Hall }until 1877.
